description: Inherited from Middle English bretage, bretace, from Old French bretesce, bretesche, breteske, from Late Latin brittisca.

entries.meaning: (mining) A wooden partition in a coal mine.
(historical) A wooden structure used for attack or defence, such as an archery tower, or a penthouse built over the entry to a castle for archers to shoot from.

verbs.description: brattice (third-person singular simple present brattices, present participle bratticing, simple past and past participle bratticed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To divide into partitions of this kind.
